faqs.question: What is the standard measurement unit for plots in Ghel and what size is recommended for a family home
faqs.answer: The standard land measurement unit used for plots in Ghel Ambala is the Marla. One Marla is approximately 25 square yards or 225 square feet. For a comfortable three-bedroom family home the 6 Marla or 8 Marla plot sizes are typically recommended as they offer sufficient space for construction adequate setbacks and parking while remaining budget-friendly. Larger families or those planning multi-story residences might opt for 10 Marla plots or more to allow for greater architectural flexibility and garden space.

faqs.question: Are the Plot For Sale in Ghel freehold or leasehold properties and what legal checks should I perform
faqs.answer: Almost all residential plots available for sale in Ghel are freehold properties meaning the buyer receives permanent and absolute ownership rights over the land. Essential legal checks include verifying the clear title deed the mutation record in the revenue department confirming there are no pending loans or mortgages against the plot and checking the zoning certificate to ensure the land is classified for residential use. We provide all these verified documents upfront.
